definition: to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to know/knowledge/Taiwan pr. [shi4]
to record/to write a footnote
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
surname Shi
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
to show no understanding of the times (idiom); cannot adapt to current circumstances/not amenable to reason
Only an outstanding talent can recognize current trends (idiom). A wise man submits to circumstances.
pinyin: shi2 shi2 wu4 zhe3 wei4 jun4 jie2

sentences.english: They put a few posters on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 這是一些不識時務的意見。

sentences.english: Those who let themselves be guided by the current course of events are real heroes.
This is the opinions of some rip van winkle .
sentences.chinese: 這是一些不識時務的意見。

sentences.english: What kind of dainty Political Correctness, objecting to political murders, should interfere with major business deals.
sentences.chinese: 多麼識時務啊，反對政治謀殺，應該干擾主要交易。

sentences.english: They regarded me as "old-fashioned" and behind the times.
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲我老“土”，不識時務。

sentences.english: This is the opinions of some Rip Van Winkle.
sentences.chinese: 這是一些不識時務的意見。

sentences.english: This is the opinion of some Rip van Winkle.
sentences.chinese: 這是一些不識時務者的意見。

sentences.english: One of the most common grievances aired at politicians is that they are out of touch.
sentences.chinese: 說到政客，人們最常抱怨的便是他們的不識時務。

sentences.english: If we take finding opportunity as foresight, then grasping opportunity is a person of outstanding talent.
sentences.chinese: 如果說發現機遇是識時務，而把握好機遇方爲俊傑。

sentences.english: This is the opinion of some Rip Van Winkle .
sentences.chinese: 這是一些不識時務的意見。

sentences.english: Iran must act with the seriousness and sense of urgency that this moment demands.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗必須識時務地認真而緊迫地採取行動。

definition: red in the face/extremely angry
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
fight to the death/desperate struggle
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
shameful secret
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
to listen with respectful attention/(a polite request to sb to speak)/we are all ears
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
to force someone to do something
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
